trial_identification.studytitle: The VALID study: is ventilation affected by leaving in dentures?
trial_identification.scientifictitle: To investigate whether bag-mask ventilation after induction of anaesthesia in patients with dentures is easier with dentures left in or removed.

interventions.interventions: The patients randomised to Group A have their dentures removed after induction of anaesthesia but before bag-mask ventilation, while the patients randomised to Group B have their dentures left in for bag-mask ventilation and removed afterwards, prior to placement of endotracheal tube or laryngeal mask airway. Bag-mask ventilation is attempted in both groups of patients for 30 seconds after loss of eyelash reflex.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Ease of bag-mask ventilation as determined by chest rise and fall
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured for 30 seconds immediately after loss of eyelash reflex.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Ease of bag-mask ventilation as determined by presence of etCO2 trace at 3 litres/min fresh gas flow
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured for 30 seconds immediately after loss of eyelash reflex.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Ease of bag-mask ventilation as determined by APL valve at 20cmH2O
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured for 30 seconds immediately after loss of eyelash reflex.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Fresh gas flow required in litres/min.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Assessed for 30 seconds immediately after loss of eyelash reflex.
Assessed for 30 seconds immediately after loss of eyelash reflex.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Requirement to use oxygen flush valve.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Assessed for 30 seconds immediately after loss of eyelash reflex.
Assessed for 30 seconds immediately after loss of eyelash reflex.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Requirement for second person to assist to seal the mask.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Assessed for 30 seconds immediately after loss of eyelash reflex.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: All patients with dentures undergoing general anaesthesia excluding those unable to give informed consent and those having rapid sequence induction were invited to participate

trial_design.sequence: computer generated block randomisation with random block size
